Text.Text: You must allow me - this is Harhord Dorm, my loyal friend and aide.  He does not care for outsiders, and will not speak a word of the Common tongue.
Sun-landers, hrm?  I am perplexed that Dargab allowed you to pass, but so be it - I trust his judgment.  My name is Barud Barzam - I am the commander of this complex.  You are...?
Hrm?  Ah, of course - you are traveling to the east, towards the monastery.
There is a storage room off this hallway - you will find mining tools in a crate there.  We intended to clear the passage soon enough - take the tools, and consider them our payment for your work.

Not so quickly, outsider.  That is one deal between us - perhaps you would agree to another.  To recapture this complex entirely, we must clear the surrounding caves of monsters.  You may rest here, and will be well rewarded...
Monetary wealth, arms and armor, all of the finest duergar craftsmanship.  You have my word that you will not be disappointed.
Excellent, most excellent.  There is a revolting menagerie of beasts lurking throughout these caves - return when the last of them is dead for your reward.
Hrm, well done.  Your reward - a sack of gold and gems and an ensorcelled duergar shield and axe.  All should serve you well, outsider.  Now, I offer a third and final deal between us...

This outpost and the Underdark passage were lost to the Black Raven Monastery decades ago, but we will reclaim both.  Slay the monks, outsider, and we will shower wealth and items of power upon you once more.
Yes, excellent.  When the last of those damnable monks - may Darkness take the lot of them - lies dead upon the floor, return to me for your reward.

Hrm - you are powerful allies, indeed.  More gold and gems to line your pockets, then - also, a suit of plate armor, a warhammer, a crossbow, all crafted and enchanted by great duergar artisans.  They are well deserved, outsider.

It was founded more than one hundred and fifty years past by a duergar expedition - a cleric led them, and thus the shrine to Laduguer.  This was little over a decade before that wretched Black Raven Monastery was built...

The monks were quick to seize control of the Underdark passage, justifying their actions with doubtful tales of "significance to their founder."  When the few duergar here made to oppose the monks, they were slaughtered...

After the monks butchered the small garrison force, the outpost was sealed and the Underdark passage barred with an iron gate.  However, the duergar neither forgive nor forget... and we have returned.

But the monks are many, and strong - our victory would require cunning.  Our ability to become as shadows allowed us to secretly pass through the gate and monastery, and retake this outpost from a pack of mangy orcs...

Yes - to fade from sight, to become invisible.  The wards of Laduguer have developed many abilities during our centuries in the darkness... abilities thought forever lost to us by our less intrepid kin.

This complex will soon form a strong foundation for an assault - when the time is right, we will contact another body of duergar troops and put an end to the monastery's unjust hold on our Underdark passage.

With your help, this complex has become a strong foundation for an assault.  When the time is right, we will contact another body of duergar troops and put an end to the monastery's unjust hold on our Underdark passage.

With your help, this complex has been recovered entirely and the vile monks are no more.  We will soon contact another body of duergar troops and reclaim the Underdark passage stolen from us so long ago.
Hrm?  Heh... of course.  When should I have my men wake you?
Hrm?!  Bah!  If you seek rest, go sleep in the caves below.
Hrm?

Foolish outsider... you have served your purpose, and now it is our time to be rid of you.  We have seen your strength, but you are no match for our duergar tactics - our "Hammer and Anvil" attack will crush you.
The duergar boast many abilities beyond those of our cowardly kin - the art of invisibility is but one of them.  But now, outsider, prepare to behold our tremendous skill in battle.
My hammer is aside, outsider.  Have you cleared the caves below of all monsters?
My hammer is aside, outsider.  Have you slain the last of those abominable Black Raven monks?
My hammer is aside, outsider.  Why have you returned?
Outsiders, hrm?  I am perplexed that Dargab allowed you to pass, but so be it - I trust his judgment.  My name is Barud Barzam - I am the commander of this complex.  You are...?

Hrm - it is rare to find our kind so close to the surface.  Still, duergar or not, I am perplexed that Dargab allowed you to pass, but so be it - I trust his judgment.  I am Barud Barzam, the commander of this complex.  You are...?

What?!  For you to ask such a question is ridiculous!  We boast many abilities beyond those of our cowardly kin - the art of invisibility is but one of them.  But now, fool, prepare to behold our tremendous skill in battle.
Hrm - so be it.
Hrm... I see you've already helped yourself to the tools in question.  No matter... we intended to clear the passage soon enough.  Keep them, and consider them our payment for your work.
What are you doing, outsider?  Get rid of the monsters you've tracked in here!
I see.
I'm <CHARNAME>.  Dargab said to ask you about mining tools.
Thanks.  I had some questions.
My thanks.  Farewell.
What's the reward?
We'll do it.
No, but I had other questions.
Perhaps another time.  Farewell.
No - I will not consciously aid the cause of black-hearted duergar.  Farewell.
We'll do it.
No, but I had other questions.
Perhaps another time.  Farewell.
That's all?  It's done, then - we left nothing alive down there.
That's all?  It's done, then - we left nothing alive down there.
What can you tell me about this place?
Can we rest here?
Farewell, Barzam.
Wait... to take this much wealth would be against the tenets of my order - I cannot accept your reward.  But please, continue...
We'll do it.
No, but I had other questions.
Perhaps another time.  Farewell.
No - I will not consciously aid the cause of black-hearted duergar.  Farewell.
Then I'll take it now - every last monk is already dead.
Then I'll take it now - every last monk is already dead.
What can you tell me about this place?
Can we rest here?
Farewell, Barzam.
Wait... to take this much wealth would be against the tenets of my order - I cannot accept your reward.
Thanks.  What can you tell me about this place?
My thanks.  Can we rest here?
You have my thanks, Barzam.  Farewell.
Go on...
Wait - I had other questions.
Never mind.  Farewell.
Go on...
Wait - I had other questions.
Never mind.  Farewell.
Go on...
Wait - I had other questions.
Never mind.  Farewell.
Go on...
Go on...
Go on...
One moment - "become as shadows?"
Wait - I had other questions.
Never mind.  Farewell.
Go on, then...
Go on, then...
Go on, then...
Wait - I had other questions.
Never mind.  Farewell.
Thanks.  I had some questions.
Can we rest here?
Can we rest here?
Farewell, Barzam.
Thanks.  I had some questions.
Can we rest here?
Farewell, Barzam.
Thanks.  I had some questions.
Can we rest here?
Farewell, Barzam.
We'll rest for eight hours.
We'll rest until we're fully healed.
Never mind.  Farewell.
What was your offer for our clearing the caves again?
What can you tell me about this place?
Farewell, then.
What was your offer for our clearing the caves again?
What was your offer for our slaying the monks again?
What can you tell me about this place?
Can we rest here?
Can we rest here?
Never mind.  Farewell.
Wait - how did you get here, behind us?
Wait - how did you get here, behind us?
We'll see about that.
Yes - we left nothing alive down there.
Yes - we left nothing alive down there.
No.  What can you tell me about this place?
No, we've not.  Can we rest here?
We haven't yet.  Farewell.
We haven't - but if we do, it won't be for any reward.  Farewell.
It's not your concern - we'll accept no reward from black-hearted duergar.  Farewell.
Yes - every last monk is already dead.
Yes - every last monk is already dead.
No.  What can you tell me about this place?
No, we've not.  Can we rest here?
We haven't yet.  Farewell.
We haven't - but if we do, it won't be for any reward.  Farewell.
It's not your concern - we'll accept no reward from black-hearted duergar.  Farewell.
What was your offer for our clearing the caves again?
What was your offer for our slaying the monks again?
What can you tell me about this place?
Can we rest here?
Can we rest here?
Never mind.  Farewell.
I'm <CHARNAME>.  Dargab said to ask you about mining tools.
I'm <CHARNAME>.  Dargab said to ask you about mining tools.
What can you tell me about this place?
Can we rest here?
Farewell, Barzam.
Thanks.  I had some questions.
My thanks.  Farewell.
